videoSnippet.title: Youngest Ever Player To Defeat Magnus Carlsen!
videoSnippet.description:
Previous Record here! Pragg vs Carlsen https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JIqppHlG-Fw

Photos by Lennart Ootes https://www.chessphotoshop.com/
Have a great day :)

Gukesh D (2606) - Carlsen, Magnus (2902)
Aimchess Rapid | Prelims (chess24.com) [9] 2022.10.16
C11 French, Steinitz, Boleslavsky variation

1.e4 e6 2.d4 d5 3.Nc3 Nf6 4.e5 Nfd7 5.f4 c5 6.Nf3 Nc6 7.Be3 a6 8.Qd2 b5 9.dxc5 Bxc5 10.Bxc5 Nxc5 11.Bd3 Qb6 12.Qf2 b4 13.Ne2 a5 14.O-O Ba6 15.f5 exf5 16.Nf4 Ne7 17.e6 f6 18.Rac1 O-O 19.c3 Qd6 20.Bxa6 Rxa6 21.cxb4 Ne4 22.Qe3 axb4 23.Nd4 Rxa2 24.Nb5 Qe5 25.Rc7 Re8 26.Qb6 Ng5 27.Rxe7 Rea8 28.Qc7 Qe3+ 29.Kh1

00:00 Hello Everyone!
01:18 Game Starts!
03:40 Completely New Game!
05:00 Pause the Video!
10:00 It was in this position!
11:50 Contributions 

The Aimchess Rapid is the 8th of 9 events on the $1.6 million 2022 Meltwater Champions Chess Tour and takes place on chess24 from October 14-21. The 16-player field will be cut in half by the 4-day round-robin Prelims. The total prize fund is $150,000, with $750 for a win and $250 for a draw in the Prelims. The quarterfinals and semi-finals are 1-day, 4-game matches, while the final will feature two such matches over two days.

The players have 15 minutes for all their moves, plus a 10-second increment starting from move 1. In the Prelims there are 3 points for a win and 1 for a draw. If a tiebreak is required the players will play two 5+3 games and then, if needed, a single Armageddon game, where White has 5 minutes to Black's 4, but a draw counts as a win for Black. No draw offers are allowed before move 40. Official website: chess24.com/tour
